Title: SQL Language Expressions
Description: Comparison operators are used to compare two expressions. The operators include < (less than), > (greater than), <= (less than or equal to), and >= (greater than or equal to). These operators return true or false based on the comparison result.
Returns: True if the comparison holds; otherwise, false.
Examples: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_amount > 100; -- Finds orders with an amount greater than 100
SELECT * FROM products WHERE price <= 50; -- Finds products priced at or below 50
